com.iha.emulator.communication.server.ssl

Class ServerReceiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • com.iha.emulator.communication.server.ssl.ServerReceiver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MessageSender, java.lang.Runnable

    public class ServerReceiver
extends java.lang.Thread
implements MessageSender
    Class providing stable server connection secured with SSL/TLS. Used for registering adapter, receiving and processing messages initiated by server.
    Author:
    Filip Sutovsky
    See Also:
    com.iha.emulator.communication.server.ssl

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ServerReceiver(AdapterController adapterController)
      Creates new ServerReceiver with given adapter controller, for which is connection initialized, and calls createSSLCertificate() to create SSL certificate and initiate SSL context

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServerReceiver

        public ServerReceiver(AdapterController adapterController)
        Creates new ServerReceiver with given adapter controller, for which is connection initialized, and calls createSSLCertificate() to create SSL certificate and initiate SSL context
        Parameters:
        adapterController - adapter controller using stable connection

    • Method Detail

      • figureOutHostName

        private void figureOutHostName()
                        throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        Gets domain name from Server.getIp() and assigns it to field hostName
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if cannot retrieve domain name for server model IP property

      • createSSLCertificate

        private void createSSLCertificate()
        Creates new certificate from certificate authority (loaded from file CA_CERT_PATH), creates KeyStore, TrustManager, initializes SSLContext and assigns it to sslContext for later use.

      • connect

        public void connect()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Creates secure connection with server over SSL, checks if socket is valid and assigns socket's input/output stream to formatted reader/writer.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - SSLSocket I/O error

      • run

        public void run()
        If connection is enabled (after successful adapter registering), starts to listen to server messages. Disabled if adapter is disabled. If connection is unexpectedly closed, method will try to reconnect.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • listenForMessages

        public void listenForMessages()
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              WrongResponseException,
                              org.dom4j.DocumentException
        Listening and processing of messages sent by server. Connection must be previously established, otherwise exception is thrown.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - connection not established or SSLSocket read I/O error
        WrongResponseException - if connection was closed, but none or not full message was received
        org.dom4j.DocumentException - if received message could not be parsed as XML

      • trimEndOfLine

        private java.lang.String trimEndOfLine(java.lang.String response)

        Removes EOL character from start of string.

        Notes:
        Used on messages from server.

        Parameters:
        response - string, that should be modified
        Returns:
        string without EOL character as first character in string

      • processMessage

        private void processMessage(org.dom4j.Document inDocument)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                            java.lang.NullPointerException
        Processes message from server as Dom4j XML document. Checks if protocol version is equal to version used by assigned adapter and afterwards passes message to adapter's Protocol instance for parsing.
        Parameters:
        inDocument - message from server as Dom4j XML document
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if message cannot be parsed by Protocol instance. (details in exception message).
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if trying to parse XML element that should be in message, but is not.

      • getMessageProtocolVersion

        public Protocol getMessageProtocolVersion(org.dom4j.Document inDocument)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates and returns instance of Protocol from protocol version number from message.
        Parameters:
        inDocument - message from server as Dom4j XML document
        Returns:
        instance of Protocol implementation
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if protocol version from message is not implemented

      • sendMessage

        public java.lang.String sendMessage(org.dom4j.Document message,
                                    ResponseTracker responseTracker,
                                    OutMessage.Type type)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    WrongResponseException

        Sends register message after establishing stable connection. This message must be sent after each successful connection. Connection must be previously established, otherwise thread will be put to sleep for DEFAULT_SLEEP_TIME and afterwards will try to reconnect.

        Specified by:
        sendMessage in interface MessageSender
        Parameters:
        message - Dom4j XML document with register message for server
        responseTracker - instance of class tracking server response time
        type - message type
        Returns:
        server response as string
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - SSLSocket I/O error or connection is not established
        WrongResponseException - if socket reached end of stream while reading or socket is not valid (details in exception message)

      • reconnect

        public void reconnect()
        Creates new register message and adds it to the top of assigned adapter's message queue. Afterwards separately running implementation of interface Scheduler will pick up this message and try to send it.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Closes socket's input/output stream and socket itself.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - closing I/O error

      • enable

        public void enable()
        Enable listening for messages. If thread is asleep, notifies it

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Sets initialization indicator and enables thread

      • disable

        public void disable()
        Disables thread. If connection is active, closes it.

      • pauseReceiver

        public void pauseReceiver()
                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Puts thread to sleep for DEFAULT_SLEEP_TIME
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if thread was interrupted during sleep

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
        Terminate thread

      • getConn

        public boolean getConn()
        Gets connection status
        Returns:
        connection status

        Gets connection status property, can be bound
        Returns:
        connection status property

        Sets connection status

        Gets connection initialization indicator

        connection initialization indicator

        public void setInitialized(boolean initialized)

        initialized - connection initialization indicator
